support_summary: Ataxin-3 is a deubiquitinating enzyme that contains a VCP-binding motif and interacts directly with VCP.

functions.cellular_process: VCP/p97, in conjunction with its cofactor ATXN3, plays a role in the early stages of autophagy. The VCP-ATXN3 complex is implicated in regulating the stability of Beclin-1 (BECN1), a key component of the class III phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase (PtdIns3K) complex I, which is essential for the initiation of autophagosome formation. While the precise molecular steps are still under investigation, it is proposed that VCP facilitates the deubiquitinase activity of ATXN3 towards BECN1, thereby preventing its degradation and promoting autophagy.
functions.effect_description: Acts as a deubiquitinase that, in concert with VCP, is thought to stabilize BECN1 to promote the formation of the autophagy initiation complex.
biological_consequence: Autophagy inducing signal → VCP and ATXN3 form a complex → ATXN3 potentially deubiquitinates and stabilizes BECN1 → Enhanced assembly and activity of the PtdIns3K complex I → Increased PI(3)P production → Nucleation and formation of autophagosomes
specific_effects: The VCP/ataxin-3 complex participates in the regulation of early stages of autophagy.

evidence.paper_title: Ataxin-3 binds VCP/p97 and regulates retrotranslocation of ERAD substrates
evidence.relevant_quote: Thus, ataxin-3 binding reduces the interaction of VCP with ubiquitinated clients and the retrotranslocation of ERAD substrates. Pathological polyQ expansion of ataxin-3 enhances VCP binding and culminates in the impairment of ERAD. In addition, the VCP/ataxin-3 complex participates in the DNA damage response by removal of the E3 ubiquitin ligase RNF8 and in the regulation of early stages of autophagy.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 interacts with VCP/p97, a crucial ATPase that extracts misfolded ubiquitinated proteins from the endoplasmic reticulum for degradation by the proteasome. ATXN3, a deubiquitinase, binds to VCP and modulates the ERAD process. It competes with the VCP cofactor Ufd1 for binding to VCP. This competition can inhibit the retrotranslocation of ERAD substrates from the ER to the cytosol, thereby regulating the flow of proteins through this degradation pathway. VCP, in turn, can activate the deubiquitinase activity of wild-type ATXN3.
functions.effect_description: Modulates the turnover of ERAD substrates by interacting with VCP and deubiquitinating substrates, which can inhibit their retrotranslocation from the ER.
biological_consequence: An ubiquitinated ERAD substrate is recognized → VCP extracts the substrate from the ER membrane → ATXN3, in complex with VCP, deubiquitinates the substrate → The binding of ATXN3 to VCP can compete with Ufd1, thereby inhibiting substrate retrotranslocation → The substrate may be released for degradation or its degradation may be stalled
specific_effects: ATXN3 binds to VCP and decreases its interaction with Ufd1 and ubiquitylated proteins. [30, 31]
ATXN3 inhibits the retrotranslocation of ERAD substrates from the ER in a reconstituted system. [30, 31]
VCP enhances the deubiquitinase activity of wild-type ataxin-3 in vitro. [6, 7, 21, 32, 35]
ATXN3 and Ufd1 bind to VCP in a mutually exclusive manner. [30, 31]

evidence.paper_title: Ataxin-3 binds VCP/p97 and regulates retrotranslocation of ERAD substrates
evidence.relevant_quote: AT3 binds VCP/p97, a key protein responsible for extracting ERAD substrates from the ER... AT3 and Ufd1 bind VCP in a mutually exclusive manner; AT3 decreases the interaction of VCP with Ufd1 as well as with ubiquitylated proteins. Using a reconstituted system, AT3 inhibits retrotranslocation of an ERAD substrate from the ER. These data suggest that a normal function of AT3 is to regulate flow through the ERAD pathway by modulating VCP-dependent extraction of proteins from the ER. [30, 31]

evidence.paper_title: Valosin-Containing Protein (VCP/p97) Is an Activator of Wild-Type Ataxin-3
evidence.relevant_quote: VCP/p97 was shown to be an activator specifically of wild-type ataxin-3, exhibiting no effect on expanded ataxin-3... [21]

mechanism: VCP/p97, in conjunction with its cofactor ATXN3, plays a role in the early stages of autophagy; ATXN3 interacts with VCP/p97, a crucial ATPase that extracts misfolded ubiquitinated proteins from t
effect: Acts as a deubiquitinase that, in concert with VCP, is thought to stabilize BECN1 to promote the formation of the autophagy initiation complex.; Modulates the turnover of ERAD substrates by interacting with VCP and deubiquitinating substrates, which can inhibit their retrotranslocation from the ER.
summary: VCP activates ATXN3 to regulate autophagy initiation and er-associated degradation (erad), ultimately affecting nucleation and formation of autophagosomes.
